events.title: Crocodile warnings as floods devastate southern Africa
events.description: More than 100 people killed and hundreds of thousands displaced in South Africa, Mozambique and Zimbabwe Devastating floods have killed more than 100 people in southern Africa since the beginning of the year and displaced hundreds of thousands, as authorities and aid workers warn of hunger, cholera and attacks by crocodiles that have spread with the waters. More than 70 people have died in Zimbabwe and 30 in South Africa, where hundreds of people were evacuated from Kruger national park earlier this month after a deluge of rain . Continue reading...

events.title: ICE killings rock Sundance and Trump faces backlash as artists and activists take a stand
events.description: As protests over the fatal shooting of Alex Pretti by federal immigration agents sweep the US, the outrage has spilled into the cultural world – reaching the red carpets of the Sundance Film Festival and igniting fierce criticism of President Donald Trump's immigration enforcement policies. At Sundance, stars including Natalie Portman and Elijah Wood donned "ICE OUT" pins and joined calls for justice following the deaths of Pretti and Renee Good at the hands of ICE and Border Patrol agents.

events.title: IRGC terrorist designation: Mirroring US policy, EU crosses Islamic regime's 'red line'
events.description: Nadia Massih welcomes Ali Vaez, Int'l Crisis Group's Iran Project Director and Senior Adviser to the President. As the EU formally designates Iran’s Revolutionary Guards as a terrorist organisation, the foundations of state-to-state diplomacy face an irreversible rupture. Meanwhile, the US weighs military options. Are we witnessing the unraveling of diplomacy or the beginning of an existential clash between the West and the Islamic regime? Could Western coercion incite the regime to further crush internal dissent and embark on a 'war of survival'?

events.title: UN chief warns ‘law of the jungle’ is replacing rule of law
events.description: Warning that the “rule of law is being replaced by the law of the jungle,” the UN Secretary-General on Monday urged world powers to recommit to international law as the foundation of peace, justice and multilateral cooperation.

events.title: Convicted terrorist who plotted consulate, church bombings to run in UK election
events.description: A Muslim activist with terror conviction runs for Birmingham City Council, sparking controversy as local elections approach in Britain's second largest city.

events.title: US congressman meets five-year-old Liam Ramos and his father at ICE detention center – as it happened
events.description: This blog has now closed. Read our latest story here Two federal officers fired their guns during the fatal shooting of Alex Pretti , according to an initial review by the Department of Homeland Security that was obtained by NBC News . Three sources told NBC News that the preliminary report, from a Customs and Border Protection internal investigation led by the agency’s Office of Professional Responsibility, was sent to congressional committees yesterday, including the House homeland security and judiciary committees. Continue reading...

events.title: EU lists Iran's powerful Revolutionary Guards as terrorist organisation
events.description: The European Union has listed Iran's paramilitary Revolutionary Guard as a terrorist organisation over Tehran's bloody crackdown on nationwide protests, the bloc's top diplomat said Thursday.

events.title: Remembering the Holocaust: ‘You are here because you choose hope over hate’
events.description: The Holocaust is a warning, that hatred “can consume everything” – a message that feels more urgent than ever, the UN chief said on Tuesday, as antisemitism rages worldwide.

events.title: Heavy security deployed at airport in Niger capital after overnight explosions
events.description: Source says two aircraft on ground in Niamey ‘destroyed’ by gunfire although authorities yet to comment on situation Heavy security has been deployed around the main airport in Niger’s capital, Niamey, after overnight gunfire and explosions. The shooting and detonations began shortly after midnight on Wednesday, according to residents of a neighbourhood near the airport, which is next to Base Aérienne 101, a military base previously used by US and then Russian troops . Continue reading...

events.title: Rafah crossing set to reopen "soon" as part of Gaza ceasefire deal
events.description: For Gazans, the Rafah border crossing to Egypt is their gateway to the world. But since Israel seized it in May 2024, it has been largely shut. Now, as part of the second phase of the Israel-Hamas ceasefire plan, Israel’s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says the crossing will reopen soon, raising hopes for thousands of war-wounded Palestinians seeking medical care abroad, and for tens of thousands of people outside Gaza seeking to return home.

events.title: Iran responds to Trump pressure with warning of retaliation: 'Fingers on the trigger'
events.description: President Donald Trump warned Iran "time is running out" on a nuclear deal, and Iran's foreign minister threatened retaliation against "aggression."

events.title: EU adds Iran's Revolutionary Guards to terrorist list
events.description: EU foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas says the move is a response to Tehran's deadly crackdown on protesters.

events.title: Melania Trump documentary dropped by South African distributors ahead of global release
events.description: January 29 sees the premiere of the documentary "Melania" at the Kennedy Center, a largely unprecedented example of a sitting US first lady commercialising her position. Melania Trump co-produced the movie, which looks at the 20 days leading up to husband Donald Trump’s return to the White House. It opens in theatres worldwide on January 30.

events.title: What is Iran's Revolutionary Guard, the paramilitary on the EU "terrorist list"?
events.description: Created in the aftermath of the 1979 Islamic Revolution - the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps is now the most powerful organization in Iran. A parallel military force - the regime's armed wing and a major economic player - it plays a central role in repressing demonstrations, like in the widespread protests which took place recently and were submitted to a deadly crackdown. Now, the EU has inscribed the organisation on its "terrorist list". Who exactly are they?

events.title: The European Union designates Iran Guards as 'terrorist organisation'
events.description: European Union foreign ministers agreed on Thursday to include the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps on the bloc's list of terrorist organisations."This will put them on the same footing with Daesh, Hamas, Hezbollah, al-Qaida" explained European foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas. The move marks a symbolic shift in Europe's approach to Iran's ​leadership after years of disagreement between the 27 member states.

events.title: US withdrawal from WHO ‘risks global safety’, agency says in detailed rebuttal
events.description: The World Health Organization (WHO) has issued a detailed statement regretting the United States decision to leave the UN agency, and declaring that it will leave both the US and the world less safe as a result.

events.title: Thursday briefing: Will Keir Starmer’s cautious China gamble pay off?
events.description: In today’s newsletter: With China now central to the world’s green tech​ and economic future, the UK faces a ​s​eries of strategic ​discussions it can no longer postpone Good morning. The Starmer has landed. Yesterday, Keir Starmer became the first British prime minister to make the trip to China since Theresa May’s in 2018 (meaning a surprisingly large number of PMs didn’t) and has vowed to bring “stability and clarity” to the UK’s approach to Beijing . Iran | Donald Trump has warned time is running out for Tehran and said a massive US armada was moving quickly towards the country. Assisted Dying | Supporters of assisted dying will seek to force through the bill using an archaic parliamentary procedure if it continues to be blocked by the Lords. UK politics | Centrist ideas are no longer wanted in the Conservative party, Kemi Badenoch has said. Ofsted | A snap inspection of a Bristol secondary school criticised for postponing a visit by an MP who is a member of a group that advocates for Israel has found “no evidence of partisan political views”. BBC | The BBC has named senior executive Rhodri Talfan Davies as its interim director general , as the corporation continues the search for a permanent replacement for Tim Davie. Continue reading...

events.title: ‘tr*nsgender ANTIFA’ extremist charged with attempted murder after skating on death threat, Rep Mace says
events.description: Suspected Antifa extremist allegedly threatened Rep. Nancy Mace with assassination, prosecutors ignored warnings, now charged with attempted murder in Portland.

events.title: German star latest to take aim at Trump ahead of FIFA World Cup in US
events.description: Bayern Munich midfielder and German international Leon Goretzka says European teams are emboldened heading to World Cup.

events.title: Greetings from Mumbai, where residents take breathing space where they can find it
events.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

events.title: UN Secretary-General to outline 2026 priorities at noon press conference
events.description: UN Secretary-General António Guterres will hold his official start-of-the-year press conference today at noon in New York, setting out his priorities for 2026 and why the UN has a crucial and positive role to play in an increasingly unstable and dangerous world. Speaking to journalists at UN Headquarters, he is expected to outline the major challenges facing the international community and the best path ahead.

events.title: ‘We must stand up for our shared humanity - each and every day’: UN human rights chief
events.description: On the eve of International Holocaust Remembrance Day, UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Türk called on the global community to “not only to look at our past, but to reflect on our present, and to safeguard our future.”

events.title: South Sudan: UN and rights experts warn against risk of mass violence in Jonglei
events.description: The UN Mission in South Sudan (UNMISS) is sounding the alarm over the threat of escalating violence in Jonglei state which is putting lives at risk and further weakening prospects for peace.

events.title: Iran slams ‘selective outrage’ after EU labels IRGC a ‘terrorist’ group
events.description: Iranian authorities reject European Union's measures, denouncing the IRGC blacklisting as 'illogical and irresponsible'.

events.title: Replay: Iran Guard joins EU "terrorist list" in "diplomatic shift" for the block
events.description: Rewatch as Kaja Kallas, European Commissionner to Foreign Affairs and Security Policy, addresses journalists following the European Union putting the Iranian Revolutionary Guard Corps on its "terrorist list". FRANCE 24's James André tells us more about what it means for the EU.

events.title: Skeletal remains identified as 19-year-old Florida man reported missing nearly a decade ago
events.description: Florida authorities confirm remains found in Miramar Beach belong to Jacob Lyon, who went missing from Niceville in 2016. A death investigation remains active.

events.title: Yemen: WFP stops operations definitively amid Houthi threats
events.description: The UN's World Food Program is dissolving contracts with staff in Houthi-controlled northern Yemen. It first suspended operations, after more than a decade of internal conflict, in August amid a Houthi crackdown.

events.title: Plane crashes in Colombia, killing all 15 on board
events.description: State ariline Satena says its aircraft carrying 13 passengers and two crew "suffered a fatal accident".

events.title: Hakan Fidan on Iran and Turkiye’s role in global security
events.description: Turkish foreign minister warns against escalation with Iran, explaining how Ankara sees the future of regional security.

events.title: "Regionally, there is a real worry" about the possibility of US strikes in Iran
events.description: The U.S. ​Navy has sent ⁠an additional warship to the Middle East, a U.S. official ​told Reuters, amid a large military ​buildup in the region and ​soaring tensions. For its part, Iran has said it could launch a pre-emptive strike or broadly target the Mideast, including American military bases in the region and Israel. FRANCE 24's James André and Reza Sayah tells us what to know about how the threats are being perceived regionally.

events.title: Second elderly South Carolina woman dead from hypothermia in winter storm
events.description: South Carolina confirms second hypothermia death from winter storm as 83-year-old woman dies in Lexington County. More extreme weather threatens the state.

events.title: Joel Osteen's Lakewood Church remembers staff member killed in Maine plane crash: 'Beautiful spirit'
events.description: Joel Osteen's Lakewood Church said a staff member who “possessed a beautiful spirit" was among the victims of a fatal private jet crash in Bangor, Maine.

events.title: Trump warns Iran 'time is running out' for nuclear deal as US military builds up in Gulf
events.description: Tehran says its armed forces are ready "with their fingers on the trigger" to respond to any aggression.

events.title: ‘It’s the sovereignty of the country’: Guinea-Bissau says US vaccine study suspended
events.description: Despite US pushback, officials in west Africa say controversial hepatitis B study on pause amid ethics concerns US health officials insisted it was still on. African health leaders said it was cancelled . At the heart of the controversy is the west African nation of Guinea-Bissau – one of the poorest countries in the world and the proposed site of a hotly debated US-funded study on vaccines. The study on hepatitis B vaccination, to be led by Danish researchers, became a flashpoint after major changes to the US vaccination schedule and prompted questions about how research is conducted ethically in other countries. Continue reading...

events.title: Climate change worsened rains, floods which killed dozens in southern Africa: Study
events.description: Researchers say human-induced climate change worsened recent torrential rains and floods in southern Africa

events.title: Russian drone attack on passenger train is an ‘act of terrorism,’ Zelenskyy says
events.description: Russian drones struck a passenger train in Ukraine's Kharkiv region, killing five in what Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy called an act of terrorism.

events.title: Ted Cruz urges US to arm Iranian protesters as militias threaten ‘total war’ against America
events.description: Ted Cruz responds to reports describing rapidly deteriorating situation as Iran-backed militias threaten 'total war' against America. He called for the U.S. to arm Iranian protesters.

events.title: At least 11 killed in second deadly minibus-truck crash in a week
events.description: At least 11 people have been killed in a crash between a truck and a minibus taxi in South Africa - the second such incident in recent days.

events.title: Africa has the worst road safety record in the world. Here's what to know
events.description: A deadly car crash in Nigeria involving former boxing champion Anthony Joshua and two minibus accidents in South Africa have highlighted Africa's poor road safety record

events.title: At least 11 killed in a crash involving a minibus taxi and a truck in South Africa
events.description: A crash involving a minibus taxi and a truck has killed at least 11 people in South Africa

events.title: ‘We children saw things that no one should ever have to see’ Holocaust survivor tells the UN
events.description: Holocaust survivor Marion Blumenthal Lazan, gave a harrowing and heart-rendering account of her childhood under Nazi persecution during Tuesday’s Holocaust Memorial event in New York, urging citizens worldwide to push back against ‘negativity’ by choosing “love, respect and compassion” in how they treat one another.

events.title: From lunch tray to lifelong health: WHO sets global standards for school meals
events.description: For the first time ever, the World Health Organization (WHO) is providing recommendations for healthy and nutritious food in schools around the world.

events.title: Combined war casualties for Russia and Ukraine could hit 2 million, new report warns
events.description: A new CSIS report warns Russia-Ukraine war casualties could reach 2 million by spring 2026, with Russia reportedly suffering 1.2 million casualties so far.

events.title: Bangladesh approves shooting team India tour, days after T20 World Cup ban
events.description: Bangladesh cricket lost their place at T20 World Cup after refusal to play in India, but shooting team heads to Delhi.

events.title: ActionAid to rethink child sponsorship as part of plan to ‘decolonise’ its work
events.description: Development charity’s new co-chief executives signal shift from controversial sponsor a child scheme launched in 1972 to long-term grassroots funding Child sponsorship schemes that allow donors to handpick children to support in poor countries can carry racialised, paternalistic undertones and need to be transformed, the newly appointed co-chief executives of ActionAid UK said as they set out to “decolonise” the organisation’s work. ActionAid began in 1972 by finding sponsors for schoolchildren in India and Kenya, but Taahra Ghazi and Hannah Bond have launched their co-leadership this month with the goal of shifting narratives around aid from sympathy towards solidarity and partnership with global movements. Continue reading...

events.title: Heating with air conditioning saves on cost and cuts CO2
events.description: From Japan to China and the US to Scandinavia, heating with air conditioning has long been standard practice. But now warming homes with AC is catching on in other parts of the world.

events.title: Gulf shipping operations grind to halt near Iran; US quietly prepares for possible strike: 'Heightened risk'
events.description: Maritime intelligence warns of heightened risks for U.S.-flagged vessels in the Persian Gulf as Iran threatens an "immediate, all-out" response to any American military action.

events.title: Israeli settler violence displaces Palestinians across occupied West Bank
events.description: Israeli settler attacks across the occupied West Bank are forcing Palestinian communities to flee.

events.title: Trump admin rewrites nuclear safety rules. And, NTSB releases findings on D.C. crash
events.description: NPR obtains documents showing the Trump administration secretly cut nuclear safety rules to fast-track new reactors. And, investigators blame systemic failures for a deadly midair crash near D.C.

events.title: EU designates Iran's Revolutionary Guard a terror group
events.description: The bloc's foreign ministers made the symbolic move in response to the brutal clampdown on protests in Iran. Meanwhile, Brussels has also imposed sanctions on 15 Iranian officials and six "entities."

events.title: Russian drone attack kills 3 in southern Ukraine as further US-led peace talks approach
events.description: A Russian drone attack has killed three people in southern Ukraine, authorities said Thursday

events.title: Video appears to show Alex Pretti spit at agents, damage SUV days before fatal shooting and more top headlines
events.description: Get all the stories you need-to-know from the most powerful name in news delivered first thing every morning to your inbox.

events.title: 'I can breathe again' says Israeli hostage held for nearly 500 days in Gaza
events.description: In his first international interview, Sasha Troufanov tells the BBC how he thought he would die in captivity after he was taken hostage on 7 October 2023.

events.title: Trump says that he will allow reopening of Venezuelan airspace
events.description: US has asserted control over Venezuela on key issues of sovereignty and made threats of further military attacks.

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: Canada separatists accused of ‘treason’ after secret talks with US state department
events.description: Alberta activists’ covert meetings with US officials revealed, outlining group’s increasingly emboldened efforts Covert meetings between separatist activists in the Canadian province of Alberta and members of Donald Trump’s administration amount to “treason”, the premier of British Columbia said on Thursday. “To go to a foreign country and to ask for assistance in breaking up Canada, there’s an old-fashioned word for that – and that word is treason,” David Eby told reporters. Continue reading...

events.title: LA protesters swarm restaurant after TSA officers reportedly misidentified as ICE agents
events.description: Protesters reportedly mistook TSA officers for ICE agents at a California restaurant, leading to a crowd gathering outside with whistles and horns.

events.title: China slams Trump administration over US sanctions on Cuba
events.description: China strongly condemns U.S. pressure on Cuba, calling sanctions violations of international law as diplomatic tensions escalate over decades-long embargo.

events.title: Can Venezuela’s Delcy Rodríguez become a Latin American Deng Xiaoping?
events.description: Maduro’s Sorbonne-educated successor is talking up an era of ‘reform and opening up’ modelled on China’s post-Mao boom After years of political and social upheaval, hunger and despair, the Great Helmsman departs and is replaced by a francophile economic reformer who catapults a traumatised country into a new era of prosperity and growth . That is what happened in China half a century ago when the croissant-loving communist Deng Xiaoping became paramount leader after Chairman Mao Zedong’s 1976 death and set in motion one of history’s biggest economic booms. Continue reading...

events.title: At least five killed after Storm Kristin hits Portugal
events.description: The storm toppled trees, damaged homes and left more than 800,000 people without power.

events.title: ‘Gobsmacked’: Australian workplace relations department to replace short-term staff with third-party contractor
events.description: Workers and union say outsourcing will mean loss of knowledge and experience needed to help ‘very vulnerable people’ waiting for government payments Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast A group of call centre staff kept on short-term contracts at the government department responsible for workplace standards will be replaced by a third-party contractor, with their union warning “vulnerable people” contacting the government could be affected. Due to laws to improve job security, 13 workers at the Department of Employment and Workplace Relations (DEWR) are unable to renew their contracts after reaching the maximum period they can remain in short-term positions, their union says. Continue reading...

events.title: Colombia plane crash: All 15 passengers on board killed
events.description: The aircraft carrying 15 people, including Congressman Diogenes Quintero, made last contact with air traffic control shortly after takeoff.

events.title: Senior politician dies in India plane crash
events.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has paid tribute after a minister was killed in a plane crash which left no survivors.

events.title: Thai Air Force says 2 pilots killed in plane crash during training mission
events.description: Two Thai Air Force pilots have died in a plane crash during a training mission

events.title: From deepfakes to grooming: UN warns of escalating AI threats to children
events.description: The staggering amount of harmful AI-generated online content has prompted an urgent call from across the UN system for a raft of measures to protect children from abuse, exploitation and mental trauma.

events.title: Holocaust survivor killed in Maserati hit-and-run crash
events.description: Holocaust survivor Andriy Korshunov, was killed by a hit-and-run driver while crossing a street with his dog in the San Fernando Valley on Tuesday,

events.title: Second teen dies after Texas sledding accident that killed best friend: ‘They were holding on to each other’
events.description: Texas community mourns loss of two high school sophomores killed in sledding accident. Grace Brito was a cheerleader, Elizabeth Angle played soccer.

events.title: Illinois teen stabs pregnant woman 70 times, knifes dog, sets home ablaze during Facebook Marketplace meetup
events.description: An Illinois teenager allegedly stabbed a pregnant mother to death dozens of times during a Facebook Marketplace meetup before setting the home on fire.

events.title: Commercial flight vanishes before crashing in Colombia, killing all 15 people on board, including congressman
events.description: A plane crash in Colombia killed 15 near the Venezuela border with a congressman aboard. Search teams have confirmed no survivors were found.

events.title: Netanyahu sounds alarm on antisemitism at Holocaust Remembrance Day gathering
events.description: Antisemitism surge prompts leaders to gather in Jerusalem for Holocaust Remembrance Day conference. Netanyahu warns ideology threatens Western civilization.

events.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
events.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

events.title: Starmer announces visa-free travel to China after talks with Xi in Beijing – UK politics live
events.description: Downing Street gives no date for when the agreement of 30 days of visa-free travel will come into force For more context on today’s Starmer - Xi meeting, China is the world’s second-biggest economy and Britain’s third-largest trading partner – to which it exports £45bn of goods and services a year – so it is no surprise the UK has turned to Beijing in its search for economic reliability. As the Guardian’s political editor Pippa Crerar reported earlier today, the UK does not rank among the top 10 of China’s trading partners but the Beijing leadership has spied a political opportunity to improve links with one of Washington’s closest allies at a time of deep uncertainty in the transatlantic alliance. Continue reading...

events.title: Marco Rubio tells senators Venezuela transition won't be fast or easy
events.description: At his first Senate Foreign Relations Committee hearing since U.S. forces seized Nicolás Maduro, Secretary of State Marco Rubio warns the U.S. could still use force to pressure Venezuela's government.

events.title: Ukraine: Trump says Putin agreed not to hit Kyiv for 1 week
events.description: President Donald Trump has said Russia's Vladimir Putin "agreed" not to strike the capital for a week with a harsh cold snap forecast. Russia routinely targets Ukraine's electricity supply. Follow DW.

events.title: 'They told us to let them die': Iranian doctor speaks on regime crackdown
events.description: In Iran, the climate of fear has been restored after the clerics who run this country successfully crushed a nationwide revolt.

events.title: World News in Brief: Deadly shipwrecks in the Mediterranean, Duterte trial update, final hostage remains recovered in Gaza, FAO boosts farming in Haiti
events.description: The UN migration agency, IOM, expressed deep concern on Monday over multiple deadly shipwrecks that are believed to have taken place over the past ten days across the Central Mediterranean.

events.title: Filipino mayor unharmed after apparent RPG attack on car in broad daylight
events.description: Mayor Akmad Ampatuan was unharmed after attackers targeted his vehicle with an apparent rocket-propelled grenade in the southern province of Maguindanao del Sur.

events.title: Heavy gunfire and blasts heard near airport in Niger's capital
events.description: The airport houses an air force base and is about 10km (six miles) from the presidential place.

events.title: Bulgarians split over new Eurozone membership
events.description: At the beginning of 2026, Bulgaria joined the Eurozone. It is a historic shift that comes at a moment of deep polarisation in the country and mass anti-corruption protests. They culminated in the resignation of its government and its president. FRANCE 24's Elitsa Gadeva and Juliette Prudhomme were on the ground during that first week of transition.

events.title: Security Council LIVE: Ambassadors debate as Middle East crises mount
events.description: The UN Security Council is holding a high-level open debate on the Middle East which is expected to focus on the Gaza peace plan – including the role of President Donald Trump’s Board of Peace – the continuing humanitarian crisis in the enclave and turmoil in the West Bank and East Jerusalem, following the demolition of UNRWA’s headquarters there. Follow live coverage below, and UN News app users can click here.

events.title: Trump threatens to end Iraq support over al-Maliki comeback bid tied to Iran influence
events.description: U.S. opposes Iran-backed al-Maliki's bid for Iraqi PM role as Secretary of State Marco Rubio expresses concerns about pro-Tehran government seizing control of Iraq.

events.title: Airports embrace AI to manage growing global passenger traffic
events.description: Airports use AI for passenger flow, baggage tracking and predictive maintenance to enhance efficiency and experience.

events.title: US cricket World Cup hero Jones suspended over multiple corruption charges
events.description: Aaron Jones was one of the key US performers at the 2024 T20 World Cup but will now miss the 2026 edition.

events.title: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs
events.description: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer François Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: Company handling Australia’s immigration detention playing key role in Trump’s ICE migrant crackdown
events.description: Albanese government awarded contracts to MTC despite allegations of ‘gross negligence’ in the US involvement with ICE Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast The Australian government’s main immigration detention contractor is playing a key role in Donald Trump’s hardline immigration crackdown and has attracted a string of complaints over its treatment of Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) detainees. In recent years, the Albanese government has awarded lucrative immigration detention contracts to the local subsidiary of Management and Training Corporation, a major US private prison company, to operate offshore processing facilities on Nauru and Australia’s onshore detention network . Continue reading...

events.title: Starmer and Xi call for deeper UK-China ties as Trump shakes up global relations
events.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer and Chinese leader Xi Jinping in Beijing called for a "comprehensive strategic partnership" to deepen ties amid global uncertainty.

events.title: Mexican president says her country has paused oil shipments to Cuba
events.description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said the pause was part of general fluctuations in oil supplies and that it was a "sovereign decision" not made under pressure from the United States.

events.title: Silver: Why the price of 'poor man's gold' has hit a record
events.description: The price of silver has just reached an all-time high of more than $120 per ounce. Although gold has eclipsed the white metal as a store of value, DW explores why silver is regaining global relevance.

events.title: Starmer's China trip provides exquisite optics for the 'world's most reliable superpower'
events.description: Let's be frank, in China the UK is not seen as a particularly big or important player.

events.title: Landslide causes homes to fall off cliff edge
events.description: Heavy rain has tiggered a landslide in southern Sicily causing the edge of a town to collapse and forcing the evacuation of more than 1,500 people.

events.title: UN food agency is shutting down operations in rebel-held northern Yemen, officials say
events.description: U.N. officials say the World Food Program is shutting down its operations in northern, rebel-held part of Yemen

events.title: German leader hails Europe as an 'alternative to imperialism and autocracy'
events.description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz says the European Union can be an “alternative to imperialism and autocracy” and can forge deals with like-minded partners in a world of increasing great power rivalry

events.title: Vietnam and the EU upgrade ties as US tariffs reshape global trade
events.description: Vietnam and the European Union have upgraded their relationship to a comprehensive strategic partnership, Vietnam’s highest diplomatic level

events.title: Vietnam and the EU upgrade ties to a comprehensive strategic partnership as Trump tariffs reshape global trade
events.description: Vietnam and the EU upgrade ties to a comprehensive strategic partnership as Trump tariffs reshape global trade

events.title: Starmer and Xi call for deeper UK-China ties as Trump shakes up global relations
events.description: The leaders of Britain and China have called for a “comprehensive strategic partnership” to deepen ties amid global uncertainty

events.title: World News in Brief: UN Support Office in Haiti, Goodwill Ambassador Theo James in Syria, urgent appeal for millions in DR Congo
events.description: The Security Council-endorsed UN Support Office in Haiti is on track to deliver on behalf of the Haitian people, UN Spokesperson Stéphane Dujarric said on Wednesday.

events.title: Brother of man accused of spraying Ilhan Omar says suspect hated Somali community for years
events.description: The man accused of spraying a substance on Rep. Ilhan Omar at a town hall event harbored years of deep hatred toward the Somali community, his brother said.

events.title: Fox News ‘Antisemitism Exposed’ Newsletter: Walz shocks with misguided Holocaust comparison
events.description: Fox News' "Antisemitism Exposed" newsletter brings you stories on the rising anti-Jewish prejudice across the U.S. and the world.

events.title: Pope Leo calls for world free from persecution while honoring Holocaust victims
events.description: Pope Leo calls Holocaust Remembrance Day a "painful remembrance" during a Vatican audience, urging vigilance against genocide and building societies rooted in respect.

events.title: Chips, anyone? German farm gives away millions of potatoes after bumper harvest
events.description: Dubbed "the great potato rescue", it is part of a plan to save the spuds from going to waste.

events.title: Talks ramp up to avert US government shutdown after Minneapolis shooting
events.description: Democrats are pushing to remove funding for the Department of Homeland Security unless new measures are implemented.

events.title: Ukraine receives 1,000 bodies in latest soldier swap with Russia
events.description: Russia received 38 soldiers' bodies in exchange as part of an agreement between the warring countries.

events.title: Flights to northern Ethiopia cancelled as fears mount of renewed conflict
events.description: Passengers received a text message about the cancellation of flights, citing "unforeseen circumstances".

events.title: Will killings in Minneapolis force another US government shutdown?
events.description: The death of Alex Pretti has prompted a shift among Democratic senators, who are willing to risk a shutdown for reforms.

events.title: Ukraine receives bodies of 1,000 soldiers from Russia
events.description: Ukraine and Russia confirm soldier body exchange, enabling families to bury loved ones as the conflict continues.

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: Hundreds feared dead in attempt to cross Mediterranean during cyclone
events.description: Fifty killed in one incident as Italian authorities estimate 380 people may have drowned last week Up to 380 people may have drowned attempting to cross the Mediterranean last week as Cyclone Harry battered southern Italy and Malta, the Italian coastguard has said, as a shipwreck with the loss of 50 lives was confirmed by Maltese authorities. Just one person, who was hospitalised in Malta, survived the shipwreck, which happened on Friday. Continue reading...

events.title: Five-year-old deported to Honduras despite being US citizen is latest child victim of Trump crackdown
events.description: Mother whose visa application was pending says she will send girl back to US soon accompanied by another relative Five-year-old Génesis Ester Gutiérrez Castellanos misses her cousins, classmates and kindergarten teachers in Austin, Texas. Despite being a US citizen, she was deported on 11 January alongside her mother, Karen Guadalupe Gutiérrez Castellanos, to Honduras, a country Génesis had never known. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents were acting on an administrative deportation order against Gutiérrez, 26, issued in 2019, before Génesis was born. Continue reading...

events.title: Keir Starmer opens door to UK visit by Xi Jinping after bilateral talks
events.description: PM says trip to China has put relationship in stronger place, but possible return visit angers British critics UK politics live – latest updates Keir Starmer has taken a big step towards rapprochement with China, opening the door to a UK visit from Xi Jinping in a move that drew immediate anger from British critics of Beijing. During the first visit by a UK prime minister to China in eight years – a period which Starmer has described as an “ice age” – he said talks with the Chinese president had left the bilateral relationship in a stronger position. Continue reading...

events.title: Two friends, an Israeli and a Palestinian, believe peace is possible after war
events.description: A Palestinian man and his Israeli friend are dedicating themselves to a peaceful coexistence in the aftermath of the devastating war in Gaza.

events.title: Italian officials voice outrage at the presence of U.S. ICE agents at the 2026 Olympics
events.description: U.S. Homeland Security agents provided security support at past Olympics. But after violence by ICE agents in Minneapolis, some Italian officials say an ICE unit is unwelcome in Milan Cortina.

events.title: China executes 11 people tied to Myanmar scam compounds
events.description: The 11 members of gangs based in northern Myanmar were sentenced to death in September. Beijing has been cracking down on cyberscam compounds in Southeast Asia in recent years.

events.title: France debates child-free zones as national train service introduces them
events.description: French rail service SNCF has announced new business-class cars would not allow children in them. Facing backlash over putting in writing that "children would not be accepted", it changed the terms to those under 12 and justified the move by saying that it was already the case and restricted to business routes and weekdays. Still, the outrage has led to a bill being drawn to outlaw kid-free zones for discrimination reasons. FRANCE 24's Solange Mougin tells us more about a phenomenon that is, nonetheless, growing.

events.title: Potential turning point for Gaza as peace plan enters second phase: UN envoy
events.description: The start of a second phase of a stabilisation plan for Gaza offers a potential turning point for the war-ravaged enclave, a senior UN official told the Security Council on Wednesday.

events.title: UN says Gaza crisis remains dire, children hardest hit
events.description: Despite a modest increase in humanitarian assistance, the situation in Gaza remains “dire”, with children among the hardest hit by shortages of shelter, basic services and education, the United Nations said on Tuesday.

events.title: Between fear and survival: Women and girls flee violence in northern Syria
events.description: When fighting recently intensified near her neighbourhood in Aleppo, in northern Syria, Fatima and her family had to run.

events.title: VMI cadets fight back as Virginia Democrats threaten to close historic military college
events.description: VMI cadets defend their military college as Virginia Democrats introduce legislation that could revoke state funding and potentially close the historic school.

events.title: Texas killer asks victims' families for forgiveness before becoming first execution of 2026
events.description: Texas carried out the nation’s first execution of the year, putting to death a man convicted of killing his ex-girlfriend and her new boyfriend in a 1998 double murder.

events.title: From 700 murdered relatives to 3 survivors: Holocaust descendant leads Israeli forces after Oct 7 attacks
events.description: Israeli colonel whose parents survived Holocaust continues military service at the age of 56, serving over 3,600 days in reserves including Gaza operations.

events.title: A new blow for UNRWA as headquarters in East Jerusalem 'set on fire'
events.description: The head of embattled UN relief agency for Palestinians, UNRWA, has condemned reports that its headquarters in East Jerusalem have been set alight deliberately.

events.title: China executes 11 members of Myanmar scam mafia
events.description: China executes 11 members of the Ming family that ran scam centres in Myanmar, state media report.

events.title: White House ‘Border Czar’ announces shift in Minnesota tactics
events.description: White House “Border Czar” Tom Homan said federal immigration agents will conduct “targeted” operations in Minnesota.

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: Mexico’s president says cancellation of oil shipment to Cuba is ‘sovereign’ decision
events.description: Claudia Sheinbaum denied move was response to pressure from the US, after Trump said ‘zero’ oil would go to Cuba Mexico has cancelled a shipment of oil to Cuba , the country’s president, Claudia Sheinbaum, appeared to confirm on Tuesday, but she insisted the decision was “sovereign” and not a response to pressure from the US. Fuel shortages are causing increasingly severe blackouts in Cuba, and Mexico has been the island’s biggest oil supplier since the US blocked shipments from Venezuela last month. This story was amended on 29 January 2026 after Alex González Ormerod’s first name was incorrectly given as Alexander. Continue reading...

events.title: Xi didn’t really see a point to Kier’s visit – but hey, let a hundred flowers bloom | John Crace
events.description: Chinese leader bestows a little largesse on the British PM while getting the green light for London ‘mega embassy’ Let’s face it, this was never going to be a meeting of equals. Keir Starmer had been desperate to squeeze in a trip to China for some time. Another country to tick off his list and he always feels a lot better about himself when he’s abroad. Less noise from his unhappy MPs. Plus he loved the pomp and ceremony that came with it. The large flags. The military bands. A country that treated him with respect. Almost. Besides, Mark Carney and Emmanuel Macron had both made recent trips. He had seen their holiday photos. Now it was his turn. He couldn’t bear to be left out. The Chinese? Not so much. They couldn’t really see the point. But they would schedule in a couple of meetings on the condition the UK government gave the green light to the new “mega embassy” near the Tower of London. Consider it done, said Keir. All systems go for the first prime-ministerial visit since Theresa May in 2018. Continue reading...

events.title: Xi-Starmer meeting: Chinese leader tells PM he hopes both countries can ‘rise above differences’
events.description: China agrees visa waiver for British citizens as countries sign agreements on closer economic cooperation UK politics live – latest updates The Chinese leader, Xi Jinping, has said the UK’s relationship with his country has gone through “twists and turns” over the years but that a more “consistent” approach is in both their interests. Before talks with Keir Starmer during the first visit to China by a British prime minister in eight years, Xi said the two men would “stand the test of history” if they could “rise above differences”. Continue reading...

events.title: Nursing a skink: endangered alpine lizard numbers set to rise after Omeo falls pregnant in Victoria
events.description: Eleven guthega skinks could soon become 13 thanks to a captive breeding program in the Alpine national park Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Eleven endangered skinks released into a gated community in Victoria’s Alpine national park could soon become 13, with a female known as Omeo due to give birth in March. One of Australia’s only alpine lizards, guthega skinks live on “sky islands” above 1,600 metres in two isolated alpine locations – the Bogong high plains in Victoria and Mount Kosciuszko in New South Wales. Continue reading...

events.title: Spain will grant legal status to immigrants lacking authorization
events.description: Spain's government announced Tuesday it will grant legal status to potentially hundreds of thousands of immigrants living and working in the country without authorization.

events.title: Confusion, anger in post-coup Guinea-Bissau
events.description: The country's opposition alleges that the ousted president staged his own coup to avoid admitting defeat in the last election. Meanwhile, political institutions are in limbo.

events.title: Kids, 'non merci': Is France a child-friendly place?
events.description: In this edition of Entre Nous, we take a look at child-free zones – why they are popular and why they also elicit outrage. After the state-owned French railway operator SNCF announced new, kid-free train carriages, we dive into whether France really is a kid-friendly place. We also discuss how children, their rights and French demography have been hot-button issues this month and what that says about children's place in today's society.

events.title: Pakistan says imprisoned ex-PM Imran Khan 'in good health' after eye procedure
events.description: Pakistan’s imprisoned former Prime Minister Imran Khan underwent a medical procedure for an eye ailment last week at a government hospital in the capital and is in good health, Information Minister Attaullah Tarar said

events.title: Bangladesh's ousted leader Hasina denounces the upcoming election from her exile in India
events.description: Bangladesh’s ousted leader Sheikh Hasina has slammed the country’s upcoming election after her party was barred from the polls, remarks that could deepen tensions ahead of the pivotal vote next month

events.title: Independent experts alarmed by child rights violations in US immigration procedures
events.description: UN-appointed independent human rights experts have raised alarm over violations of children’s rights during US immigration procedures, nearly a year after federal funding for legal representation for unaccompanied minors was terminated.

events.title: Alvin Bragg’s ‘unrealistic’ timeline in Luigi Mangione case sets up showdown with Trump DOJ
events.description: Luigi Mangione's defense calls Manhattan DA's July trial date "unrealistic" as accused assassin faces parallel federal court proceedings in September.

events.title: Federal judge gives man 15 years for Iran-backed assassination plot on US soil
events.description: Federal judge sentences would-be assassin to maximum 15 years for plotting to kill Iranian American journalist Masih Alinejad for Iran's government.

events.title: Nicki Minaj calls herself Trump's 'number one fan' and shows off gold card visa
events.description: The rapper, born in Trinidad and Tobago, praises the US president while Bruce Springsteen protests aboout ICE.

events.title: What could happen if the US strikes Iran? Here are seven scenarios
events.description: From regime change to retaliation, the BBC's Frank Gardner outlines possible outcomes of US strikes on Iran.

events.title: Inside Gaza after Israel’s last captive is found
events.description: With the final Israeli captive returned, Palestinians are waiting to see if Israel will now implement a true ceasefire.

events.title: Key questions about US military build-up near Iran
events.description: Trump is building up a military force in the Middle East, saying the US is ready to strike Iran.

events.title: U.S. allies looking to China for deals as Trump threats them with tariffs
events.description: President Trump's tariffs and rhetoric have spurred some longtime U.S. allies to diversify their trade ties away from the U.S. Some are going cap-in-hand to Asian superpowers China and India.

events.title: Democrats threaten shutdown if White House does not restrict ICE budget
events.description: Senate Democrats say they will block legislation that would fund the Department of Homeland Security and several other agencies on January 28, potentially bringing the government a step closer to a partial shutdown if Republicans and the White House do not agree to new restrictions on President Donald Trump's surge of immigration enforcement. FRANCE 24's Fraser Jackson tells us more.

events.title: French IT group Capgemini under fire over ICE migrant tracking contract
events.description: French IT services giant Capgemini has been in the spotlight for days over a deal its American subsidiary CGS signed with US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), which French media and campaign groups say involves providing tools to identify foreigners on US soil and track their locations.

events.title: Plane crash kills 15 including politician
events.description: A small passenger plane has crashed in northern Colombia, killing all 15 people on board, including a congressman.

events.title: The European Union sanctions 15 officials and 6 organizations in Iran over brutal crackdown on protesters
events.description: The European Union sanctions 15 officials and 6 organizations in Iran over brutal crackdown on protesters

events.title: Gaza ceasefire improves aid access, but children still face deadly conditions
events.description: The fragile ceasefire in the Gaza Strip is making a difference to the lives of over a million children, and improving overall access to food - but more aid still needs to enter.

events.title: Medical watchdog unloads on VCU after nurse fired for viral anti-ICE TikTok video suggested drugging agents
events.description: VCU nurse fired after viral TikTok videos showed her suggesting harmful tactics against ICE agents, sparking widespread medical watchdog outrage.

events.title: UK reopens Chagos Islands talks with US following Trump criticism of deal: reports
events.description: Chagos Islands talks between U.K. and U.S. reopened after President Donald Trump called the Mauritius deal an "act of great stupidity" as British Prime Minister Keir Starmer says discussions have resumed.

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: US says aid will resume while Somali officials deny causing disruption leading to suspension
events.description: The United States say it is lifting a suspension of aid to Somalia

events.title: Latin American leaders call for unity against growing political polarization
events.description: Latin American leaders have gathered for a development forum, calling for regional unity amid increasing political polarization and recent U.S. intervention in Venezuela

events.title: Chabad official speaks out after car-ramming of Jewish center, as NYPD probes motive
events.description: A driver allegedly rammed his car into Chabad headquarters in New York City multiple times. No injuries reported as officials investigate the motive.

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Rosé used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: Australia spends more on tax breaks for landlords than social housing, homelessness and rent assistance combined
events.description: Exclusive: Acoss report shows property investors received $12.3bn in tax concessions in 2025, while the share of social housing dropped to a record low Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Australia spends billions of dollars more on tax breaks for property investors than on social housing, homelessness and rent assistance combined, according to research by the Australian Council of Social Service (Acoss). The analysis comes as new data from the Productivity Commission reveals the share of homes dedicated to social housing has dropped to a record low 3.6%, from 5.7% in the 1990s. Continue reading...

events.title: Access to RSS feeds is rejected
events.description: Your large amount of concurrent requests for RSS data causes problems. Use the API or contact ops@reliefweb.int

events.title: Senegal and Morocco fined and players banned after African Cup final chaos
events.description: Africa's soccer body issued fines worth more than $1 million and banned Senegal's coach and Senegalese and Morocco players Wednesday following a shambolic African Cup soccer final this month.

events.title: Senegal and Morocco fined and banned after AFCON final chaos
events.description: Africa's governing football body has issued more than $1 million in fines after the chaotic scenes at the end of the AFCON final. In addition, a number of players and Senegal's coach face bans.

events.title: Jewish family brings France to trial over Baghdad embassy
events.description: A Jewish family is suing France over its embassy in Baghdad. It seeks compensation for what it says is France's use of property and unproper rent pay. The house was seized alongside with other property of Jewish Iraqis in the 1950s. France argues that is this is a problem with Iraqi law and should be dealt with in an Iraqi court. But the family cannot go to Iraq as it is illegal for Jews to go there. FRANCE 24's Shirli Sitbon tells us more.

events.title: What is Nipah virus? The highly lethal disease causing concern across Asia
events.description: Airports across Asia have put urgent steps in place to stop the spread of a highly lethal virus.

events.title: ICE detains New Orleans police recruit after immigration judge signed removal order following his hiring
events.description: New Orleans police recruit reportedly taken into ICE custody over immigration status after passing background checks and E-Verify screening process.

events.title: Former North Carolina elections official allegedly drugged teens' ice cream: report
events.description: Former North Carolina elections official allegedly placed pills in teens' ice cream cones, facing felony charges after grand jury indictment.

events.title: China infiltrates key Pacific territory of Micronesia with infrastructure projects as US urged to act
events.description: China opens new runway in Micronesia's Yap islands, raising serious U.S. defense concerns in this strategically vital Pacific region amid growing tensions.

events.title: Israel hands over 15 bodies of Palestinians in last stage of captive swap
events.description: Palestinians still waiting for the Red Cross to turn over the bodies either in Khan Younis or Gaza City.

events.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
events.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

events.title: German court upholds damages after discrimination by realtor
events.description: Germany's top civil court ruled a property agent must pay damages for discriminating against a prospective tenant based on ethnicity. The applicant filed several applications under different names to prove her point.

events.title: US border czar in Minnesota to 'regain law and order'
events.description: President Donald Trump's border czar, Tom Homan, touched down in Minneapolis and has pledged changes, but no stop to ICE operations in the city. Trump himself recently hinted at a desire to de-escalate. DW has more.

events.title: Yemen: Security Council votes on final extension of Hudaydah Mission
events.description: The Security Council adopted a resolution on Tuesday that renews the mandate of the UN Mission in the Yemeni port city of Hudaydah for a final two-month period through 31 March of this year.

events.title: France moves to abolish concept of marital duty to have sex
events.description: The proposed bill would enshrine in law the end of so-called "conjugal rights" – the notion that marriage means a duty to have sex.

events.title: Melania Trump documentary not showing in South African cinemas
events.description: No reason has been given but the decision follows a huge fall-out between South Africa and the US.

events.title: US Senator Amy Klobuchar announces bid for Minnesota governor
events.description: She fills the void for Democrats after current Governor Tim Walz ended his re-election campaign early.

events.title: Indians pay tribute after Arijit Singh retires at 38 as Bollywood singer
events.description: Singh has been one of the most loved and recognisable voices of Bollywood for more than a decade.

events.title: Europe must act urgently and stop outsourcing defence, says EU's Kallas
events.description: The EU foreign policy chief's remarks come days after Nato's secretary general said Europe needed the US for its defence.

events.title: Deutsche Bank offices raided in money laundering probe
events.description: Officials searched offices in Frankfurt and Berlin in relation to "past business relationships".

events.title: Polar bears on Norwegian islands fatter and healthier despite ice loss, scientists say
events.description: Scientists think that Svalbard bears have adapted to recent ice loss by eating more land-based prey.

events.title: Mexico’s oil industry faces new pressures from Venezuela oil under US
events.description: Pemex, burdened with significant debt, financial and operational constraints, now faces competition from Venezuelan oil.

events.title: Al Jazeera denounces YouTube’s compliance with Israel’s ban on network
events.description: Livestreams of Al Jazeera Arabic, Al Jazeera English and Al Jazeera Mubasher blocked in Israel.

events.title: Spain launches probe as expired vaccines given to 253 children
events.description: Basque health minister apologises, says expired vaccines pose no risk to 253 patients affected, mostly children.

events.title: French ISIL suspects transferred from Syria allege torture in Iraqi prisons
events.description: French lawyers for suspected ISIL members transferred from Syria say men suffering inhumane treatment in Iraqi jails.

events.title: What’s UpScrolled, the app gaining popularity after TikTok’s US takeover?
events.description: Disgruntled TikTok users are flocking to the platform which is promising a ‘transparent tech' experience.

events.title: Trump border security chief Homan doubles down on Minnesota operations
events.description: Top official promises shift in operations after killings of US citizens, but says Trump not 'surrendering' mission.

events.title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
events.description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

events.title: Analysis: Fox News is about to enter the true No Spin Zone
events.description: This is it.

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship — and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.title: The most beautiful sections of China's Great Wall
events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Sign up to our newsletter for a weekly roundup of travel news
events.description: No description available.

events.title: A cabal of male Liberals signals Ley’s reign is ending. But the day of a colleague’s memorial is obscene timing
events.description: As images of a secret meeting were splashed all over the media, it became clear the internal plot to oust the leader has descended into political melodrama The images of a cabal of rightwing Liberal men gathering for clandestine talks to overthrow the party’s first female leader – hours before a memorial service for a late former colleague, no less – confirmed two things. First, the internal plot to oust Sussan Ley has descended into a political melodrama. Continue reading...

events.title: M 5.5 - 9 km ESE of Dianga, China
events.description: PAGER - YELLOW ShakeMap - VII DYFI? - IV Time 2026-01-26 06:56:02 UTC 2026-01-26 06:56:02 UTC at epicenter Location 34.028°N 103.305°E Depth 10.00 km (6.21 mi)

events.title: The EU takes on Musk's AI that 'undresses' women. Can it protect its citizens?
events.description: The EU is probing Elon Musk’s Grok AI after its deepfake feature generated millions of sexualized images of women and children. Brussels is putting its toughest tech laws to one of their biggest test yet.

events.title: Trial against German carnival satirist Tilly underway in Russia
events.description: Jacques Tilly's carnival floats mocking Vladimir Putin have landed him before a Moscow court. As the trial drags on, the Dusseldorf-based satirist has denounced the charges as an assault on freedom of expression.

events.title: Germany's Bundeswehr shopping list
events.description: Germany is spending more on weapons and military equipment than ever before. For the first time, this also includes combat drones.

events.title: India's 2036 Olympic aspirations face tough scrutiny
events.description: As India positions itself for a 2036 Olympic bid, questions over governance, infrastructure and sporting performance cast a long shadow.

events.title: Germany news: Merz says Europeans 'not subordinates' to US
events.description: Chancellor Friedrich Merz called on Europe to stand up in the face of US dominance and condemned Donald Trump's criticism of NATO troops in Afghanistan. DW has more.

events.title: Anti-woke Germans in Russia used as propaganda for Putin
events.description: Media in Moscow are selling a narrative of mass Western migration to Russia, especially from Germany. Numbers contradict the Kremlin's claims.

events.title: Trump tariffs, dollar's dip a double-hit to eurozone exports
events.description: The euro has reached its highest level against the US dollar since 2021. That has consequences for eurozone companies and consumers, but few think that the European Central Bank should intervene yet.

events.title: Why fans are obsessed with 'Bridgerton'
events.description: Opulent romance, a diverse cast and plotlines that meld fairytales with a modern zeitgeist: "Bridgerton" has redefined the period-piece genre.

events.title: UK's Keir Starmer visits China as Beijing courts US allies
events.description: Keir Starmer is in China for the first trip by a British prime minister since 2018. He is the latest in a string of European leaders to visit recently, with German Chancellor Friedrich Merz soon to follow.

events.title: Senegalese wrestling champion Modou Lô turns his hand to boxing in Paris
events.description: A living legend in Senegal, wrestler Modou Lô, undisputed champion and 'king of the arenas', is training in Paris alongside professional boxer Souleymane Cissokho. The session offers a break from routine training and a chance to combine wrestling, boxing and future projects between athletes.

events.title: Novelist Boualem Sansal elected to Académie française months after release from Algerian jail
events.description: French-Algerian writer Boualem Sansal has been elected to the Académie française, the prestigious French language watchdog, two months after he was released from an Algerian prison on humanitarian grounds.

events.title: Rapper Nicki Minaj says she is Donald Trump's 'number one fan'
events.description: Rap icon Nicki Minaj declared Wednesday she was Donald Trump's "number one fan." The US president called the provocative singer-songwriter up on stage after she announced her support for so-called "Trump Accounts," which provide trust funds for children.

events.title: Did NASA really discover a temporary, second moon?
events.description: Is a “temporary second moon” really going to orbit the Earth? That’s the claim made in a number of viral social media posts that feature spectacular AI-generated visuals. Spoiler: contrary to these depictions, there is no second moon, but an interesting object, known as a “quasi-moon”, has been identified by scientists. Here’s what we know.

events.title: French luxury brands face growing competition from ultra-fast-fashion
events.description: Paris fashion week is currently underway with luxury brands showcasing their "haute couture" summer collection for the upcoming season. But the industry is now facing increasingly growing competition from ultra-fast-fashion, which has transformed consumer behaviour. Giants like Shein now use artificial intelligence to identify growing trends and produce and sell faster.

events.title: China executes 11 members of scam mafia family
events.description: China has executed 11 members of a mafia family for killing 14 people and running a crime syndicate worth more than $1bn, authorities said.

events.title: Tyson Fury announces comeback fight - and it'll screen on Netflix
events.description: Tyson Fury has confirmed his return to boxing with a comeback fight against Arslanbek Makhmudov.

events.title: South Korea's former first lady jailed for 20 months for corruption
events.description: The wife of South Korea's former president Yoon Suk Yeol - who was ousted over a martial law bid - has been jailed for 20 months for corruption.

events.title: Pope tells Vatican office that processes sex abuse cases to uphold truth, justice and charity
events.description: Pope Leo XIV has told the Vatican doctrine office to uphold truth, justice and charity when deciding clergy sex abuse cases

events.title: Costa Ricans support Chaves’ successor in the presidential election as crime remains high
events.description: Costa Ricans appear ready to vote to continue supporting the program of outgoing President Rodrigo Chaves in Sunday’s presidential election

events.title: French energy giant TotalEnergies resumes Mozambique $20 billion project as insurgency slows
events.description: French energy giant TotalEnergies has resumed its $20 billion gas project in northern Mozambique

events.title: China executes 11 members of Myanmar-based group in crackdown on scam operations
events.description: China has executed 11 people it found guilty of killing 14 Chinese citizens and running scam and gambling operations worth more than $1 billion

events.title: ASEAN does not recognize military-ruled Myanmar's elections, top Philippine diplomat says
events.description: The Philippine foreign secretary says the Association of Southeast Asian Nations does not recognize the recently held elections in Myanmar, the first since the army seized power in 2021

events.title: From family farm to climate tech: How one Kenyan woman is helping farmers outsmart drought
events.description: “Giving up is not an option - so many people depend on you,” the words of Maryanne Gichanga, a participant in a UN supported initiative, which aims to help farmers in Kenya find solutions to alleviate the pressures of climate change on agriculture production.

events.title: Officer clings to life after homicide suspect allegedly unloads gun on police during high-risk arrest
events.description: Texas police officer Alexandria Cano-Castro is in critical condition after allegedly being shot by a homicide suspect during an incident in Corpus Christi.

events.title: China executes 11 people convicted in scam crackdown
events.description: Chinese authorities on Thursday announced they executed 11 people convicted in a massive cross-border fraud scheme worth roughly $1.4 billion.

events.title: Spain legalizes up to 500,000 undocumented migrants, sparking backlash
events.description: Spain announced plans to grant legal status to 500,000 undocumented migrants over three years, taking the opposite approach from Trump's border crackdown.

events.title: French lawmakers declare 'battle for free minds' after approving social media ban for children under 15
events.description: French lawmakers paved the way for a bill banning social media for children under 15, following Australia's lead in protecting children from digital harm.

events.title: Witkoff celebrates 'new day in the Middle East' after final Israeli hostage is returned from Gaza
events.description: All hostages from Gaza have returned home as Trump administration completes historic Middle East diplomatic achievement, marking end of painful chapter.

events.title: North Korea launches short-range ballistic missiles into sea, show of force ahead of political meetings
events.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un's regime tests ballistic missiles as tensions rise in the region ahead of a massive political party gathering.
